Summary: I observed a solid spherical object hover in the air, disappear, reappear and then disappear.
divs: Sighting DetailsI was driving along Division Street in Stevens Point, WI, at approximately 7:38pm, Tuesday, May 29th, when I saw a metallic silver spherical object hovering in the sky in front of me at about 30' off the horizon. I immediately recognized that it was not an airplane or helicopter as it was completely round, hovered, and had no blinking lights. I kept my eyes on the object as I went through an intersection and observed it for appoximately 15 seconds before it simply disappeared. I pulled the car over and parked along Division Street. I scanned the sky for the object and it appeared again approximately 30 seconds later. It was in basically the same place, though a few degrees off from its original position. Once again, it appeared to be a metalic silver spherical object with a very distinct outline - no lights, wings, rotors. I watched it for approximately 10 seconds before it disappeared or "winked out" once again. I continued to sit in the same position and scan the sky for 10 more minutes, but did not see it again. NOTE 1: I don't know if it's relevant or not, but observing the object did not make me feel excited, scared or uneasy; I simply felt as if I was observing any other sort of object. NOTE 2: This is the second time I have seen an object in the air above Stevens Point, WI, that fits the description of the object listed above. I did not report the object the first time I saw it.
trends: There have been 17 other sightings in Stevens Point
